Posts.Content: Oct 1, 2009 06:23AM Marjorie707 wrote: I will be right there with you!  I start rads that day too.  I forgot to ask about being around my grandson.  They did tell me I could work, so I imagine it's okay to be around everyone.
Posts.Title: can I be around my 3 year old son during radiation treatments??? aaronali12 Leah_S

Posts.Content: Sep 12, 2009 08:59AM Marjorie707 wrote: Tabatha00, My taxol infusions took about an hour.  That's after my pre-meds of about 20 minutes each.  I never experienced any nausea.  I did have achy joints and was congested for a few days each round.  I also expreienced sleeplessness, just like on the A/C, from the steroids.  I had a little neuropathy, but it wasn't constant. My hair started growing back in on the taxol.  I had lost it all on A/C. Good luck!  You'll get through it!
Posts.Title: Taxol - How long does it take? Tabatha00 shadow38

Posts.Content: Sep 29, 2009 12:37PM Marjorie707 wrote: I was never sick going through chemo.  My hair started falling out 2 days after my second AC treatment.  I had my head shaved 3 days later.  I did feel very tired going through it.  9:00 PM was late for me to go to bed!
